uploaded_text:
Toyota Kirloskar Motor Pvt. Ltd. (TKM) requires services from ABC Software Pvt. Ltd. (ABC) to provide the required support for resources for Digital Transformation activities in Sales and Marketing area. ABC had provided support resources for SDD2 department, IS division for S&M Applications sustenance and development and extended the same to support in DUR, DN, PU and ST Phases of Factory DX project activities for the period from Apr 2023 -Mar 2025. TKM would like to continue the services for DX activities requirements study, design, development, and System testing activities for the duration from 01-Apr 2025 to 31-Mar 2026.
ABC shall therefore provide the required manpower to deliver the required services as per the defined Schedule and roles and responsibilities to TKM-IS from 01-Apr 2025 to 31-Mar 2026

uploaded_text:
The scope of work to be undertaken by the Support Resources shall include, but not be limited to, the following activities:
Conduct a detailed assessment of business requirements and perform necessary enhancements or modifications to the existing system.
Design and develop robust application architecture and database schema in alignment with project objectives.
Carry out coding, configuration, and initial validation through unit testing.
Perform defect identification, analysis, and resolution during all stages of development.
Assist during system integration, validation, and final acceptance testing phases.
Provide technical documentation and handover support to ensure seamless deployment and maintenance.
**Project Deliverables**
The following deliverables are expected as part of the engagement:
Requirement and Impact Analysis Reports – capturing system gaps, enhancement needs, and proposed corrections.
Design Artifacts – including process flow diagrams, entity-relationship (ER) models, and detailed data structure documentation.
Code Packages and Unit Test Reports – with evidence of functionality verification and issue logs.
Integration & Functional Test (IFT) Documentation – including test scenarios, execution logs, and results.
System Test Summary Report – detailing comprehensive test outcomes, fixes, and validation results.
Final Release Package – containing the approved source code, build scripts, executables, and configuration instructions.

• The support team shall operate entirely from an offsite location using their own computing devices, software licenses, and communication tools.
• No physical infrastructure, network connectivity, or email access shall be sought or provided by TKM.
• All coordination, meetings, and reviews shall be conducted virtually through mutually agreed online platforms.
• The service provider shall make independent travel and logistical arrangements if physical presence is ever required, at their own discretion and cost.

uploaded_heading: Support Methodology. :: Key Assumptions and Points
uploaded_text:
Once upon a time in a quiet forest, there lived a little sparrow who built her nest on a small neem tree. Nearby, a proud peacock often showed off his colorful feathers, dancing each morning before the sun.
One day, the peacock laughed at the sparrow.
“Look at you! Your feathers are plain and dull. How do you even show your face among such beauty?”
The sparrow smiled and said, “Feathers don’t make a bird great, my friend — wings do.”
That afternoon, heavy rain poured from the sky. The peacock’s heavy feathers got soaked, and he could not fly to shelter. The little sparrow, light and quick, flew up to a dry branch and stayed safe.
When the rain stopped, the peacock looked up and said, “Now I see — bright feathers can’t help in a storm.”
The sparrow chirped kindly, “Every gift has its time to shine.”

uploaded_text:
In a small village, there lived an old farmer who had three sons. They always quarreled among themselves — about land, money, even about who worked harder.
One day, the old man fell sick and decided to teach them a lesson. He called his sons and gave each one a stick.
“Break it,” he said.
Each son snapped his stick easily.
Then the father tied three sticks together into a bundle and said, “Now try to break this.”
The eldest tried and failed. The second tried and failed. Even the youngest, who was the strongest, couldn’t do it.
